title: Drawing, "Design for a watch chain and two bracelets", ca. 1870
medium: Graphite, brush and pale yellow wash on white wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: One below the other. The watch chain with three balls connected by thin pieces of chain. The first bracelet has six disks connected by joints. The fifth and fourth vine leaves, the second and fifth with a nude boy standing between leaves, the third and sixth with the mask of a girl. The second bracelet has in the center a tablet with VBI AMOR / IBI ANIMA.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for a watch chain and two bracelets", ca. 1870.Graphite, brush and pale yellow wash on white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6352.
